metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.code_html:
// Create a scanner object
Scanner myObj = new Scanner("A long is a number between -9,223,372,036,854,775,808 and 9,223,372,036,854,775,807");

// Print the value of every long in the scanner
while (myObj.hasNext()) {
  if (myObj.hasNextLong()) {
    System.out.println(myObj.nextLong());
  } else {
    myObj.next();
  }
}

content.text: The hasNextLong() method returns true if the next token represents a number that can be stored by the long data type, which is any whole number between -9,223,372,036,854,775,808 and 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.
content.html: The hasNextLong() method returns true if the next token represents a number that can be stored by the long data type, which is any whole number between -9,223,372,036,854,775,808 and 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.

content.text: The scanner is able to interpret digit groupings, such as using a comma for separating groups of 3 digits. The format of the groupings depends on the locale settings of the scanner, which can be changed with the useLocale() method.
content.html: The scanner is able to interpret digit groupings, such as using a comma for separating groups of 3 digits. The format of the groupings depends on the locale settings of the scanner, which can be changed with the useLocale() method.

content.text: If the radix parameter is used, then it interprets numbers using the radix. For example, a radix of 16 would interpret numbers as hexadecimal (digits 0 to 9 and A to F). If the radix parameter is not used then it interprets numbers using the scanner's radix, which is 10 by default but it can be changed with the useRadix() method.
content.html: If the radix parameter is used, then it interprets numbers using the radix. For example, a radix of 16 would interpret numbers as hexadecimal (digits 0 to 9 and A to F). If the radix parameter is not used then it interprets numbers using the scanner's radix, which is 10 by default but it can be changed with the useRadix() method.

content.text: A token is a sequence of characters separated from other tokens by delimiters. The default delimiter is a block of whitespace characters but it can be changed with the useDelimiter() method.
content.html: A token is a sequence of characters separated from other tokens by delimiters. The default delimiter is a block of whitespace characters but it can be changed with the useDelimiter() method.

content.code_html: public boolean hasNextLong()
public boolean hasNextLong(int radix)

Parameter Description
radix Optional. Specifies the radix used to interpret numbers. The radix specifies how many different symbols can be used to represent a digit in a number.
